definition: to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)

sentences.english: Customers will be notified on the shipment date via our order confirmation.
sentences.chinese: 客户将通过我们的订单确认函被通知启运的日期。

sentences.english: We are pleased to inform you that goods have been dispatched today.
sentences.chinese: 货物今日业已启运，特此奉告。

sentences.english: When the goods are dispatched, we'll issue a sight draft against you.
sentences.chinese: 货物一启运，我方即向贵方开出即期汇票。

sentences.english: The goods sailed yesterday from London.
sentences.chinese: 这批货物昨天已从伦敦装船启运。

definition: variant of 啟運|启运[qi3 yun4]
to enter a pass/to go through customs
to provide transport/to accept the Mandate of Heaven/to acknowledge one's calling to be emperor
to forward goods/to ship/to distribute/transshipment/a lucky break/change of fortune (for the better)
land route/to go by surface transport
a port for external trade/a trading or transit post on border between countries
old name for Shenyang 瀋陽|沈阳 in modern Liaoning province
